message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and physical examination suggest a diagnosis of hemolytic anemia. Elevated total bilirubin also confirms this. The Direct Coombs Test is used to confirm the diagnosis of immune hemolytic anemia. Serum ferritin is used to detect iron deficiency anemia. The elevated total bilirubin and pale complexion also support this diagnosis. Of the options, the Direct Coombs Test is used to detect antibodies attached to red blood cells, which can indicate immune-mediated hemolytic anemia. Serum ferritin and Hemoglobin electrophoresis are not useful in this case, and RAST is used to diagnose allergies.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, especially the sensation of heartbeat roaring in the ears, may suggest hemolytic anemia, which can be caused by autoimmune hemolytic anemia (AIHA). Direct Coombs test is used to confirm the diagnosis of AIHA, by detecting antibodies or complement proteins that bind to the patient's red blood cells. Serum ferritin, RAST, and hemoglobin electrophoresis are not relevant to the diagnosis of AIHA.
